meanings.definition: To move with a sudden jerky motion.
meanings.sent1: The train jolting as it started moving.
meanings.sent2: She jolted awake when the alarm rang.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected noise jolted the cat off the couch.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident jolted him out of his daydream.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake jolted the entire city awake in the middle of the night.

meanings.sent1: The sudden jolting of the car on the bumpy road made her feel sick.
meanings.sent2: He felt a jolting sensation as the roller coaster took a sharp turn.
meanings.sent3: The jolting of the boat on the rough waves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected jolting of the elevator startled the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The jolting of the earthquake caused dishes to fall off the shelves.
